radiographic_examinations.findings: The lung bases are clear. A 5 mm foci of arterial hyper enhancement is seen in segment 6, which likely represents a transient hepatic intensity difference. No suspicious focal lesions in the liver. No intra or extrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation and no evidence of stones. Fluid pocket seen in the gallbladder fossa, likely related to recent surgery. The pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys are normal. No lymphadenopathy and normal abdominal aorta. Small vertebral body hemangiomas in the lower thoracic and lumbar spine.
